perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, except with regards to its rules regarding choice of law.  Each party irrevocably consents to the jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Illinois and the federal courts situated in the State of Illinois, in connection with any action to enforce the provisions of this Agreement, to recover damages or other relief for breach or default under this Agreement, or otherwise arising under or by reason of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects in accordance with the laws of a state to be determined later, except with regards to its rules regarding choice of law. Each party consents to the jurisdiction of the courts of a state to be determined later, in connection with any action to enforce the provisions of this Agreement, to recover damages or other relief for breach or default under this Agreement, or otherwise arising under or by reason of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies Illinois law governs the agreement. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by stating the governing law will be 'a state to be determined later.' This contradiction undermines the enforceability of the contract as the jurisdiction is uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FROM ANY AND ALL CAUSES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROGRAM MALFUNCTION OR OPERATIONAL NEGLIGENCE, SHALL BE LIMITED TO GENERAL MONEY DAMAGES IN AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED THE TOTAL CHARGES PAID BY ABW FOR THE SERVICES DURING THE MOST RECENT TWELVE (12) MONTHS OF THE AGREEMENT. SUCH LIMITATION SHALL BE THE EXTENT OF PCQ OR ABW'S LIABILITY REGARDLESS OF THE FORM IN WHICH ANY LEGAL OR EQUITABLE ACTION MAY BE BROUGHT AGAINST PCQ OR ABW, AND THE FOREGOING SHALL CONSTITUTE PCQ'S OR ABW'S SOLE REMEDY.  IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR LOST PROFITS OR SPECIAL INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHICH ABW OR PCQ INCUR OR EXPERIENCE ON ACCOUNT OF ENTERING INTO OR RELYING ON THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF PCQ OR ABW HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text: LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FROM ANY AND ALL CAUSES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROGRAM MALFUNCTION OR OPERATIONAL NEGLIGENCE, SHALL BE LIMITED TO GENERAL MONEY DAMAGES IN AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED THE TOTAL CHARGES PAID BY ABW FOR THE SERVICES DURING THE MOST RECENT TWELVE (12) MONTHS OF THE AGREEMENT. SUCH LIMITATION SHALL BE THE EXTENT OF PCQ OR ABW'S LIABILITY REGARDLESS OF THE FORM IN WHICH ANY LEGAL OR EQUITABLE ACTION MAY BE BROUGHT AGAINST PCQ OR ABW. ABW is entitled to seek lost profits or special indirect, incidental or consequential damages that ABW incurs or experiences due to entering into or relying on this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text limits liability, preventing claims for lost profits or consequential damages. The modified text introduces a direct contradiction by stating that ABW *is* entitled to seek these damages. This creates a significant legal ambiguity about the scope of liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Limitation of Liability Clause

perturbation.original_text: Any notice, approval, request, authorization, direction or other communication under this Agreement shall be given in writing and shall be deemed to have been delivered and given for all purposes, (i) on the delivery date if delivered personally to the party to whom the same is directed, or (ii) three business days after the mailing date, whether or not actually received, if sent by registered U.S. mail postage and charges prepaid, to the address of the party to whom the same is directed as set forth in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement.  Either party may change its address specified above by giving the other party notice of such change in accordance with this Section 13.B.
perturbation.changed_text: Any notice, approval, request, authorization, direction or other communication under this Agreement can be given verbally or in writing and shall be deemed to have been delivered and given for all purposes, (i) immediately if delivered personally or verbally to the party to whom the same is directed, or (ii) three business days after the mailing date, whether or not actually received, if sent by registered U.S. mail postage and charges prepaid, to the address of the party to whom the same is directed as set forth in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. Either party may change its address specified above by informing verbally the other party of such change in accordance with this Section 13.B.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires all communications to be in writing. The modified version now allows for verbal communication, and verbal updates on address changes, creating conflicting standards for official notices. This weakens the enforceability of the agreement as verbal communications are harder to prove and track.
